AAA.name: Goods description
AAA.desc: [7002] Plain language description of the nature of the goods sufficient to identify them at the level required for banking, Customs, statistical or transport purposes, avoiding unnecessary detail (Generic term).

AAB.name: Terms of payments
AAB.desc: [4276] Conditions of payment between the parties to a transaction (generic term).

AAD.name: Dangerous goods, technical name
AAD.desc: Proper shipping name, supplemented as necessary with the correct technical name, by which a dangerous substance or article may be correctly identified or which is sufficiently informative to permit identification by reference to generally available literature.

AAG.name: Party instructions
AAG.desc: Indicates that the segment contains instructions to be passed on to the identified party.

AAH.name: Customs information
AAH.desc: [4034] Information entered by Customs on the CIM.

AAJ.name: Additional conditions of sale/purchase
AAJ.desc: Additional conditions specific to this order or project.

AAK.name: Price conditions
AAK.desc: Information on the price conditions that are expected or given.

AAL.name: Goods dimensions in characters
AAL.desc: Expression of a number in characters as length of ten meters.

AAM.name: Equipment re-usage restrictions
AAM.desc: Technical or commercial reasons why a piece of equipment may not be re-used after the current transport terminates.

AAN.name: Handling restriction
AAN.desc: Restrictions in handling depending on the technical characteristics of the piece of equipment or on the nature of the goods.

AAO.name: Error description (free text)
AAO.desc: Error described by a free text.

AAP.name: Response (free text)
AAP.desc: Free text of the response to a communication.

AAR.name: Terms of delivery
AAR.desc: (4053) Free text of the non Incoterms terms of delivery. For Incoterms, use: 4053.

AAT.name: Mode of settlement information
AAT.desc: Free text information on an IATA Air Waybill to indicate means by which account is to be settled.

ABC.name: Conditions of sale or purchase
ABC.desc: Additional information regarding terms and conditions which apply to the transaction.

ABD.name: Nature of transaction
ABD.desc: An indication for customs of the type of contract under which goods are supplied.

ABE.name: Additional terms and/or conditions (documentary credit)
ABE.desc: Additional terms and/or conditions to the documentary credit.

ABF.name: Instructions or information about standby documentary credit
ABF.desc: Instruction or information about a standby documentary credit.

ABG.name: Instructions or information about partial shipment(s)
ABG.desc: Instructions or information about partial shipment(s).

ABI.name: Additional handling instructions documentary credit
ABI.desc: Additional handling instructions for a documentary credit.

ABK.name: Chargeable category of equipment
ABK.desc: Equipment types are coded by category for financial purposes.

ABO.name: Discrepancy information
ABO.desc: Free text or coded information to indicate a specific discrepancy.

ABQ.name: Method of issuance
ABQ.desc: Method of issuance of documentary credit.

ABR.name: Documents delivery instructions
ABR.desc: Delivery instructions for documents required under a documentary credit.

ABS.name: Additional conditions
ABS.desc: Additional conditions to the issuance of a documentary credit.

ABY.name: Regulatory information
ABY.desc: The free text contains information for regulatory authority.

ABZ.name: Instructions/information about revolving documentary credit
ABZ.desc: Instructions/information about a revolving documentary credit.

ACC.name: Factor assignment clause
ACC.desc: Assignment based on an agreement between seller and factor.

ACD.name: Reason
ACD.desc: Reason for a request or response.

ACE.name: Dispute
ACE.desc: A notice, usually from buyer to seller, that something was found wrong with goods delivered or the services rendered, or with the related invoice.

ACF.name: Additional attribute information
ACF.desc: The text refers to information about an additional attribute not otherwise specified.

ACG.name: Absence declaration
ACG.desc: A declaration on the reason of the absence.

ACH.name: Aggregation statement
ACH.desc: A statement on the way a specific variable or set of variables has been aggregated.

ACI.name: Compilation statement
ACI.desc: A statement on the compilation status of an array or other set of figures or calculations.

ACJ.name: Definitional exception
ACJ.desc: An exception to the agreed definition of a term, concept, formula or other object.

ACK.name: Privacy statement
ACK.desc: A statement on the privacy or confidential nature of an object.

ACL.name: Quality statement
ACL.desc: A statement on the quality of an object.

ACM.name: Statistical description
ACM.desc: The description of a statistical object such as a value list, concept, or structure definition.

ACN.name: Statistical definition
ACN.desc: The definition of a statistical object such as a value list, concept, or structure definition.

ACO.name: Statistical name
ACO.desc: The name of a statistical object such as a value list, concept or structure definition.

ACP.name: Statistical title
ACP.desc: The title of a statistical object such as a value list, concept, or structure definition.

ACQ.name: Off-dimension information
ACQ.desc: Information relating to differences between the actual transport dimensions and the normally applicable dimensions.

ACR.name: Unexpected stops information
ACR.desc: Information relating to unexpected stops during a conveyance.

ACS.name: Principles
ACS.desc: Text subject is principles section of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ACT.name: Terms and definition
ACT.desc: Text subject is terms and definition section of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ACV.name: Simple data element name
ACV.desc: Text subject is name of simple data element.

ACW.name: Scope
ACW.desc: Text subject is scope section of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ACX.name: Message type name
ACX.desc: Text subject is name of message type.

ACY.name: Introduction
ACY.desc: Text subject is introduction section of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ACZ.name: Glossary
ACZ.desc: Text subject is glossary section of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ADA.name: Functional definition
ADA.desc: Text subject is functional definition section of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ADB.name: Examples
ADB.desc: Text subject is examples as given in the example(s) section of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ADC.name: Cover page
ADC.desc: Text subject is cover page of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ADE.name: Code value name
ADE.desc: Text subject is name of code value.

ADF.name: Code list name
ADF.desc: Text subject is name of code list.

ADG.name: Clarification of usage
ADG.desc: Text subject is an explanation of the intended usage of a segment or segment group.

ADH.name: Composite data element name
ADH.desc: Text subject is name of composite data element.

ADI.name: Field of application
ADI.desc: Text subject is field of application of the UN/EDIFACT rules for presentation of standardized message and directories documentation.

ALL.name: All documents
ALL.desc: The note implies to all documents.

ARR.name: Arrival conditions
ARR.desc: Conditions under which arrival takes place.

AUT.name: Authentication
AUT.desc: Name, code, password etc. given for authentication purposes.

BLC.name: Bill of lading clause
BLC.desc: Clause on the bill of lading regarding the cargo being shipped.

BLR.name: Transport document remarks
BLR.desc: Remarks concerning the complete consignment to be printed on the bill of lading.

CCI.name: Customs clearance instructions
CCI.desc: Any coded or clear instruction agreed by customer and carrier regarding the declaration of the goods.

CEX.name: Customs clearance instructions export
CEX.desc: Any coded or clear instruction agreed by customer and carrier regarding the export declaration of the goods.

CIP.name: Customs clearance instruction import
CIP.desc: Any coded or clear instruction agreed by customer and carrier regarding the import declaration of the goods.

CLP.name: Clearance place requested
CLP.desc: Name of the place where Customs clearance is asked to be executed as requested by the consignee/consignor.

CLR.name: Loading remarks
CLR.desc: Instructions concerning the loading of the container.

COI.name: Order information
COI.desc: Additional information related to an order.

CUR.name: Customer remarks
CUR.desc: Remarks from or for a supplier of goods or services.

DAR.name: Damage remarks
DAR.desc: Remarks concerning damage on the cargo.

DCL.name: Declaration
DCL.desc: [4020] Text of a declaration made by the issuer of the document (CIM 12).

DIN.name: Delivery instructions
DIN.desc: Instructions regarding the delivery of the cargo.

EUR.name: Effective used routing
EUR.desc: Physical route effectively used for the movement of the means of transport.

FBC.name: First block to be printed on the transport contract

GBL.name: Government bill of lading information
GBL.desc: Free text information on a transport document to indicate payment information by Government Bill of Lading.

GEN.name: Entire transaction set
GEN.desc: Note is general in nature, applies to entire transaction segment.

GS7.name: Further information concerning GGVS par. 7
GS7.desc: Special permission for road transport of certain goods in the German dangerous goods regulation for road transport.

HAN.name: Handling instructions
HAN.desc: [4078] Instructions on how specified goods, packages or containers should be handled.

ICN.name: Information for consignee
ICN.desc: [4070] Any remark given for the information of the consignee (CIM 21).

IMI.name: Invoice mailing instructions
IMI.desc: Instructions as to which freight and charges components have to be mailed to whom.

IND.name: Commercial invoice item description
IND.desc: Free text describing goods on a commercial invoice line.

IRP.name: Information for railway purpose
IRP.desc: [4090] Date entered by railway stations when required, e.g. specified trains, additional sheets for freight calculations, special measures, etc.. (CIM 8).

ITR.name: Inland transport details
ITR.desc: Information concerning the pre-carriage to the port of discharge if by other means than a vessel.

ITS.name: Testing instructions
ITS.desc: Instructions regarding the testing that is required to be carried out on the items in the transaction.

LOI.name: Loading instruction
LOI.desc: Instructions where specified packages or containers are to be loaded on a means of transport.

MCO.name: Miscellaneous charge order
MCO.desc: Free text accounting information on an IATA Air Waybill to indicate payment information by Miscellaneous charge order.

OSI.name: Other service information
OSI.desc: General information created by the sender of general or specific value.

PAC.name: Packing/marking information
PAC.desc: Information regarding the packaging and/or marking of goods.

PAI.name: Payment instructions information
PAI.desc: The free text contains payment instructions information relevant to the message.

PMD.name: Payment detail/remittance information
PMD.desc: The free text contains payment details.

PRF.name: Price calculation formula
PRF.desc: Additional information regarding the price formula used for calculating the item price.

QIN.name: Quarantine instructions
QIN.desc: Instructions regarding quarantine, i.e. the period during which an arriving vessel, including its equipment, cargo, crew or passengers, suspected to carry or carrying a contagious disease is detained in strict isolation to prevent the spread of such a disease.

QQD.name: Quality demands/requirements
QQD.desc: Specification of the quality/performance expectations or standards to which the items must conform.

RAH.name: Risk and handling information
RAH.desc: Information concerning risks induced by the goods and/or handling instruction.

REG.name: Regulatory information
REG.desc: The free text contains information for regulatory authority.

RET.name: Return to origin information
RET.desc: Free text information on an IATA Air Waybill to indicate consignment returned because of non delivery.

RQR.name: Requested routes/routing instructions
RQR.desc: [3074] Names of places via which the consignor requests a consignment to be routed.

RQT.name: Tariffs and route requested
RQT.desc: [4120] Stipulation of the tariffs to be applied showing, where applicable, special-agreement numbers or references; indication of routes by frontier points or by frontier stations and, when necessary, by transit stations between.

SIC.name: Sender's instruction to carrier
SIC.desc: [4284] Instructions given and declarations made by the sender to the carrier concerning Customs, insurance, and other formalities.

SIN.name: Special instructions
SIN.desc: Special instructions like licence no, high value, handle with care, glass.

SLR.name: Ship line requested
SLR.desc: Shipping line requested to be used for traffic between European continent and U.K. for Ireland.

SPA.name: Special permission for transport, generally
SPA.desc: Statement that a special permission has been obtained for the transport (and/or routing) in general, and reference to such permission.

SPG.name: Special permission concerning the goods to be transported
SPG.desc: Statement that a special permission has been obtained for the transport (and/or routing) of the goods specified, and reference to such permission.

SPP.name: Special permission concerning package
SPP.desc: Statement that a special permission has been obtained for the packaging, and reference to such permission.

SPT.name: Special permission concerning transport means
SPT.desc: Statement that a special permission has been obtained for the use of the means transport, and reference to such permission.

SRN.name: Subsidiary risk number (IATA/DGR)
SRN.desc: Number(s) of subsidiary risks, induced by the goods, according to the valid classification.

SSR.name: Special service request
SSR.desc: Request for a special service concerning the transport of the goods.

SUR.name: Supplier remarks
SUR.desc: Remarks from or for a supplier of goods or services.

TDT.name: Transport details remarks
TDT.desc: Additional information related to transport details.

TRA.name: Transportation information
TRA.desc: General information regarding the transport of the cargo.

TRR.name: Requested tariff
TRR.desc: Stipulation of the tariffs to be applied showing, where applicable, special agreement numbers or references.

ZZZ.name: Mutually defined
ZZZ.desc: Note contains information mutually defined by trading partners.
